dataModel.name: MODS (Minimum Operational Data Set for a Digital Social Care Record)

extensions.extension: MODS (Minimum Operational Data Set for a Digital Social Care Record)
Minimum Operational Data Set for a Digital Social Care Record

dataClass.name: Care and support needs
dataClass.description: Care and support needs identified as part of a care act assessment

enumerations.enumeration: Needs support to communicating and making wishes / needs known
Needs support to do the things you want to do for work / learning / shopping and relaxing
Needs support to eat and drink
Needs support to get around safely in home
Needs support making and keeping friendships and maintaining contact with people who are important
Needs support managing health and wellbeing
Needs support washing, bathing or showering
Needs support to be appropriately clothed
Needs support caring adequately caring for dependents, such as children
Needs support with safety and security
Needs support to reduce risk of falling

enumeration.value: Significant need - Altered state of consciousness

enumerations.enumeration: Significant need relating to altered state of consiousness
Significant need relating to medication management
Significant need relating to psychological support

dataClass.name: GP Practice
dataClass.description: Details of the person's GP practice

dataElement.name: GP Practice name
dataElement.description: Clinical referral information

extensions.extension: Registered GP Practice details are available from the Patient Demographics Service (PDS)

dataElement.name: GP Practice indentifier
dataElement.description: This is a unique identifier code for the practice.

extensions.extension: This should be the Organisation Data Services (ODS) identifier for the practice.

dataElement.name: CQC Location ID number
dataElement.description: This is a unique identifier code for the practice registered with CQC.

extensions.extension: It is the number starting with 1- found in the web address of the service searched for on CQC's website

dataClass.name: Care organisation
dataClass.description: General model for care organisations i.e. health organisation / care provider

dataElement.name: PCSP status
dataElement.description: Has a personalised care and support planning been completed for the individual.

dataClass.name: Care worker
dataClass.description: The details of the person’s professional contacts including other regulated care providers

dataElement.name: Name
dataElement.description: The name of the professional with responsibility for the care of the person.

dataElement.name: Role
dataElement.description: The role the professional has in relation to the person e.g. GP, physiotherapist, community nurse, social worker, key worker, care home manager, care coordinator, LA hospital liaison person, care home contact, hospital clinician, Independent Mental Capacity Advocate (IMCA) etc

dataElement.name: Key worker
dataElement.description: A flag that identifies the personal contact is the key worker assigned to the person.

dataElement.name: Speciality
dataElement.description:
Format/Length:an5
National Codes:See JOB_ROLE_CODE
Default Codes:

Notes:
CARE_PROFESSIONAL_(JOB_ROLE_CODE) is the same as attribute JOB_ROLE_CODE.

dataElement.name: Organisation code
dataElement.description: The coded value for location

extensions.extension: NHS data dictionary : - Organisation data service

dataElement.name: Organisation name
dataElement.description: The name of the organisation the person represents

dataElement.name: Telephone number
dataElement.description: Telephone number of the professional

dataElement.name: Email address
dataElement.description: Email address of the professional

dataElement.name: Professional identifier
dataElement.description: A number or set of characters which uniquely identifies a CARE_PROFESSIONAL.

dataElement.name: Care team
dataElement.description: A unique identifier for a CARE_PROFESSIONAL_TEAM.

dataClass.name: GP
dataClass.description: The details of the person’s professional contacts including other regulated care providers

dataClass.name: Local authority professional
dataClass.description: The details of the person’s professional contacts including other regulated care providers

dataClass.name: Carer
dataClass.description: Somebody who provides support or who looks after a family member, partner or friend who needs help because of their age, physical or mental illness, or disability.

dataElement.name: Carer relationship
dataElement.description:
Format/Length:an3
National Codes:See RELATIONSHIP_TO_PERSON_FOR_COMMUNITY
Default Codes:

Notes:
PERSON_RELATIONSHIP_(MAIN_CARER) is the same as attribute RELATIONSHIP_TO_PERSON_FOR_COMMUNITY.

PERSON_RELATIONSHIP_(MAIN_CARER) is the relationship between the PATIENT and the PERSON who undertakes the main caring role for them.

For specific National Code usage , see RELATIONSHIP_TO_PERSON_FOR_COMMUNITY.

dataType.name: RELATIONSHIP TO PERSON FOR COMMUNITY TYPE

dataClass.name: Carer's name
dataClass.description: Details of the person's name

dataElement.name: Preferred name
dataElement.description: The name by which a person wishes to be addressed. The preferred name volunteered by the person or a preferred name given by the Personal Deomographic Service (PDS) that the person has asked to be called by. This may be different from their legal name.

extensions.extension: NHS data dictionary: - Person full name

dataElement.name: First name
dataElement.description: The first name(s) of the person. This includes middle names. Legal name on birth certificate.

extensions.extension: NHS data dictionary :- Person given name

dataElement.name: Family name
dataElement.description: The family name or surname of the person.

extensions.extension: NHS data dictionary : - Person family name

dataClass.name: Carer's contact details
dataClass.description: Telephone and email details

dataElement.name: Preferred contact method
dataElement.description: Preferred contact method, e.g. email, letter, phone, text message etc

extensions.extension: NHS data dictionary :- Communication contact method

dataElement.name: Person's telephone number type
dataElement.description: The contact type e.g. home, mobile

extensions.extension: FHIR value set: - Contact point use

dataType.name: Contact point use
dataType.description: FHIR value set - contact point use + carer

enumerations.enumeration: A communication contact point at a home; attempted contacts for business purposes might intrude privacy and chances are one will contact family or other household members instead of the person one wishes to call. Typically used with urgent cases, or if no other contacts are available.
An office contact point. First choice for business related contacts during business hours.
A temporary contact point. The period can provide more detailed information.
This contact point is no longer in use (or was never correct, but retained for records).
A telecommunication device that moves and stays with its owner. May have characteristics of all other use codes, suitable for urgent matters, not the first choice for routine business.
A communication contact point for a carer

dataElement.name: Telephone number
dataElement.description:
Format/Length:max an35
National Codes:
Default Codes:

Notes:
UK_TELEPHONE_NUMBER is the same as attribute COMMUNICATION_CONTACT_STRING where the COMMUNICATION_CONTACT_METHOD is National Code 'UK Telephone Number'.

UK_TELEPHONE_NUMBER is a number, including any exchange or location code, at which a PERSON or ORGANISATION can be contacted in the UK by telephonic means.

Note:
This was null approved for use in NHS England.
null and the null have been archived and are available for reference only.

extensions.extension: NHS data dictionary : - UK telephone number

dataElement.name: Email address
dataElement.description:
Format/Length:max an255
National Codes:
Default Codes:

Notes:
CONTACT_EMAIL_ADDRESS_(PATIENT_OR_LEAD_CONTACT) is the same as attribute COMMUNICATION_CONTACT_STRING where the COMMUNICATION_CONTACT_METHOD is National Code 'Internet e-Mail Address'.

CONTACT_EMAIL_ADDRESS_(PATIENT_OR_LEAD_CONTACT) is the INTERNET_E-MAIL_ADDRESS of the PATIENT or the PATIENT's lead contact who is the designated contact.

extensions.extension: NHS data dictionary :- Contact email address NHS data dictionary :- Contact email address

dataElement.name: Person's email address type
dataElement.description: The type of email address, home, work

extensions.extension: FHIR value set: - Contact point use

dataElement.name: Preference of email address
dataElement.description: The preferred order of use of email address

extensions.extension: Preference of use 1-5, 1 being the highest.

dataClass.name: Health and Wellbeing
dataClass.description: See https://www.scie.org.uk/care-act-2014/assessment-and-eligibility/eligibility/wellbeing. personal dignity (including treatment of the individual with respect) physical and mental health and emotional wellbeing protection from abuse and neglect control by the individual over their day-to-day life (including over care and support provided and the way they are provided) participation in work, education, training or recreation social and economic wellbeing domestic, family and personal domains suitability of the individual’s living accommodation the individual’s contribution to society.

dataElement.name: About Me assessment status
dataElement.description: Has the About Me assessment been completed for the individual.

dataClass.name: Impairment record
dataClass.description: A record of any impairments for the person relating to reasonable adjustments.

dataElement.name: Impairment category
dataElement.description: The category of the impairment e.g. Autism, Dementia, Physical disability, Sensory disability - such as sight or hearing, Long-term condition

extensions.extension: Free text field to be used if no code is available

dataElement.name: Coded value
dataElement.description: The coded value for impairment.

dataElement.name: Impairment additional detail
dataElement.description: Description of what the person can do with the impairment, what they want to be able to do and how they should be supported to do it and what the consequences are of not providing the support. Where there is a sensory disability include sensory processing difficulties (e.g. affects to balance and movement, oversensitive, under-sensitive).

dataClass.name: Mental capacity assessment
dataClass.description: A record of any impairments for the person relating to reasonable adjustments.

dataElement.name: Date
dataElement.description: The date the assessment was done.

extensions.extension: Free text field to be used if no code is available

dataElement.name: Assessment summary
dataElement.description: The summary of the assessment

dataElement.name: Name
dataElement.description: The name of the professional.

dataElement.name: Role
dataElement.description: The role the professional has in relation to the person e.g. GP, physiotherapist, community nurse, social worker etc

dataElement.name: Organisation
dataElement.description: The name of the organisation the professional works for.

extensions.extension: NHS data dictionary : - Organisation data service

dataElement.name: Professional identifier
dataElement.description: Professional identifier for the person completing the record e.g. GMC number, HCPC number etc, or the personal identifier used by the local organisation.

extensions.extension: NHS data dictionary :- Professional registration identifier

dataElement.name: Contact details
dataElement.description: Contact details of the professional

extensions.extension: NHS data dictionary : - UK telephone number

dataClass.name: Medication administration record
dataClass.description: Each entry holds details of medications administered

dataElement.name: Medicine name
dataElement.description: May be generic name or brand name.

dataElement.name: Coded value
dataElement.description: The coded value for medication name

extensions.extension: dm+d:- any code from the VTM, VMP, AMP, VMPP and AMPP concept classes

dataElement.name: Form of medicine
dataElement.description: The form of the medication e.g. capsule, drops, tablet, lotion etc.

extensions.extension: SNOMED CT: - ^999000781000001107 | National Health Service dictionary of medicines and devices dose form simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

dataElement.name: Route
dataElement.description: The route by which the medication is administered e.g. oral, IM, IV

dataElement.name: Route coded value
dataElement.description: The coded value for route

extensions.extension: SNOMED CT: - ^999000051000001100 |ePrescribing route of administration simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

dataElement.name: Quantity supplied
dataElement.description: The quantity of the medication (e.g. tablets, inhalers, etc.) provided to the person. This may be dispensed by the pharmacy or on the ward. Record in a structured format i.e. value and a unit

dataElement.name: Additional instructions
dataElement.description: * requirements for adherence support, e.g. compliance aids, prompts and packaging requirements * additional information about specific medicines e.g. where specific brand required * person requirements, e.g. unable to swallow tablets.

dataClass.name: Repeat medication
dataClass.description: Is the medication prescribed to be repeated

dataElement.name: Number of repeat prescriptions
dataElement.description: The number of repeated prescriptions

dataElement.name: Review date
dataElement.description: Date to review the repeat medication prescribed to the person

dataClass.name: Allergies and adverse reactions record entry
dataClass.description: Allergies and adverse reactions

dataElement.name: Type of reaction
dataElement.description: The type of reaction experienced by the person (allergic, adverse, intolerance)

dataElement.name: Causative agent
dataElement.description: The agent such as food, drug or substances that has caused or may cause an allergy, intolerance or adverse reaction in this person Or “No known drug allergies or adverse reactions” Or “Information not available”

dataElement.name: Coded value
dataElement.description: The coded value for causative agent

extensions.extension: SNOMED CT : - <105590001 |Substance OR <373873005 |Pharmaceutical / biologic product| OR <<716186003 |No known allergy| OR 196461000000101 |Transfer-degraded drug allergy| OR 196471000000108 |Transfer-degraded non-drug allergy) 0 ...

dataElement.name: Severity
dataElement.description: A description of the severity of the reaction.

dataElement.name: Coded value
dataElement.description: The coded value for severity

dataClass.name: Vaccinations
dataClass.description: Details of vaccinations

dataElement.name: Vaccine product
dataElement.description: Vaccine product administered.

extensions.extension: VMP (Virtual Medicinal Product) or AMP (actual medicinal product)

dataElement.name: Vaccine procedure
dataElement.description: The procedure which was used to administer the vaccine.

extensions.extension: Free text or SNOMED Code (refsets to be developed e.g. children)

dataElement.name: Manufacturer
dataElement.description: Name of vaccine manufacturer.

extensions.extension: Derived from GS1 code or Free text

dataElement.name: Body site
dataElement.description: Body site vaccine was administered.

extensions.extension: Choice of • Text • Coded text – constraint: SiteOfMedicationAdministration. Any valid site for the administration of a medication. Constraint binding: [SNOMED-CT]subset= SiteOfMedicationAdministration site code

dataElement.name: Route
dataElement.description: How the vaccine entered the body.

extensions.extension: Coded text – constraint: NHS e-prescribing route of administration subset ID: 413001000001136 Original Id : 30201000001137 This is an extract from the SUBSET -BiAnnual-Drug-15.0.1-20130401: SnomedCT_GB1000001_20130401/Subsets/EPrescribing/NHS e-Prescribing route of administration subset. Constraint binding: [SNOMED-CT]subset=NHS e-Prescribing route of administration subset.

dataElement.name: Indication
dataElement.description: The clinical indication or reason for administering the vaccine.

extensions.extension: This will be free text/proposal to use the list from below (as an example list)Routine mass immunisation 171279008|Immunization due (finding)|Travel to endemic area 414448007|Identified as high risk for travel immunization (finding)|Planned travel to high risk area 161096004|Going to travel abroad (finding)|Recent travel to high risk area 506931000000109|Recent travel to disease affected area (finding)|Subpopulation at special or unusual risk 78648007|At risk for infection (finding)|High risk due to occupation 14679004 Occupation (occupation)High risk due to lifestyle 134436002|Lifestyle (finding)|High risk due to existing medical condition 398192003|Co-morbid conditions (finding)|Control of known sporadic outbreak 443684005|Disease outbreak (event)|Patient request 183995001|Patient requested procedure (situation)|Post-exposure prophyaxis 444107005|Exposure to communicable disease (event)|Other 723620004|Requires vaccination (finding)

dataElement.name: Dose amount
dataElement.description: Amount of vaccine administered.

extensions.extension: This will be free text or coded units of measure (from DM+D)

dataElement.name: Dose number
dataElement.description: The dose number of vaccine administered.

dataElement.name: Date of Vaccination
dataElement.description: The date on which the vaccination was administered or the reported/partial date on which it was reported.

dataClass.name: Alerts
dataClass.description: This is an alerts record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items

dataElement.name: Alert
dataElement.description: Any significant information meriting a specific and highly visible warning to any user (e.g. metallic implant, potential dangerous pet).

dataElement.name: Name
dataElement.description: The name of the person completing the record.

dataElement.name: Role
dataElement.description: The organisational role of the person completing record.

dataElement.name: Organisation
dataElement.description: The organisation the person completing the record works for.

extensions.extension: NHS data dictionary : - Organisation data service

dataElement.name: Professional identifier
dataElement.description: Professional identifier for the person completing the record e.g. GMC number, HCPC number etc, or the personal identifier used by the local organisation.

extensions.extension: NHS data dictionary :- Professional registration identifier

dataElement.name: Date completed
dataElement.description: The date and time the record was completed.

dataElement.name: Contact details
dataElement.description: Contact details of the person completing the record.

extensions.extension: NHS data dictionary : - UK telephone number

dataClass.name: Consent for sharing Information
dataClass.description: Details of the person's consent for information sharing

dataElement.name: Date
dataElement.description: The date when consent was given or not given

dataElement.name: Consent for information sharing
dataElement.description: This is a record of consent for information sharing under the common law duty of confidentiality. Where consent has not been obtained or sought, the reason why should be provided. Include best interests decision where person lacks capacity. This is a placeholder until the national guidance is published.

dataElement.name: Reason if consent not given
dataElement.description: Reason not given for consent

dataClass.name: Cardio-pulmonary Resuscitation consent
dataClass.description: The cardio-pulmonary resuscitation (CPR) decision

dataElement.name: Coded value
dataElement.description: The coded value for CPR decision or DNACPR

extensions.extension: SNOMED CT: - 450475007 | For cardiopulmonary resuscitation (finding) |, 450476008 | Not for cardiopulmonary resuscitation (finding) |

dataElement.name: CPR Decision
dataElement.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

dataElement.name: Date for review
dataElement.description: The date for review of CPR decision

dataElement.name: Location of document
dataElement.description: The location of the CPR decision document

dataClass.name: Lasting power of attorney for health and welfare or court-appointed deputy (or equivalent)
dataClass.description: Details of the person's LPA record or equivalent

dataElement.name: Date
dataElement.description: The date the LPA was recorded

dataElement.name: Location of document
dataElement.description:
An ORGANISATION_CODE is a code which identifies an ORGANISATION uniquely.

ORGANISATION CODES are managed by:

  • null (null)
  • NHS_Prescription_Services
  • NHS_Dental_Services.

Notes:

  • null codes can be downloaded from null
  • null contact details can be found at Contact_Details.
All NHS ORGANISATIONS are coded using coding frames, as shown in the tables at: Organisation_Coding_Frames.

dataClass.name: Liberty Protection Safeguards or equivalent
dataClass.description: Details of the person's Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards (DoLS) or equivalent

dataElement.name: Application date
dataElement.description: The date the LPA was recorded

dataElement.name: Application status
dataElement.description: The location of the CPR decision document

dataElement.name: Liberty Protection Safeguards or equivalent
dataElement.description: Record of Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards (DoLS) or equivalent, including the reason for this.

dataElement.name: Start date of authorisation
dataElement.description: The date the DOLs was authorised.

dataElement.name: Planned or actual end date of authorisation
dataElement.description: The planned or actual end date of authorisation.

dataClass.name: Mental health act or equivalent status
dataClass.description: Details of the persons mental health act record

dataElement.name: Section start date
dataElement.description: The date the person was detained.

dataElement.name: Section end date
dataElement.description: The date the person was no longer detained.

dataElement.name: Location
dataElement.description: Record of Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards (DoLS) or equivalent, including the reason for this.

dataElement.name: Mental health act legal status
dataElement.description: The coded value for mental health act or free text if not available.

extensions.extension: NHS data dictionary: - Mental health act legal status classification code

dataType.name: MENTAL HEALTH ACT LEGAL STATUS CLASSIFICATION CODE TYPE

enumerations.enumeration: Formally detained under Mental Health Act Section 2
Formally detained under Mental Health Act Section 3
Formally detained under Mental Health Act Section 4
Formally detained under Mental Health Act Section 5(2)
Formally detained under Mental Health Act Section 5(4)

dataElement.name: Supporting information
dataElement.description: If person subject to Community Treatment Order or Conditional Discharge (or equivalent) record here.

extensions.extension: NHS data dictionary : - Community treatment order

dataClass.name: Referral
dataClass.description: See https://develop.digitalsocialcare.co.uk/#/45275/dataModel/45275/main?path=45275

dataElement.name: Name of Referrer
dataElement.description: The name of the referrer.

dataElement.name: Role
dataElement.description: Role of the referrer.

dataElement.name: Service Name
dataElement.description: The service of the referrer.

extensions.extension: SNOMED CT: - 1127531000000102 |Services simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

dataElement.name: Telephone number
dataElement.description: The contact details of the referrer.

dataElement.name: Email Address
dataElement.description: The contact details of the referrer.

dataClass.name: Reason for Referral
dataClass.description: Reason for Referral

dataElement.name: Reason for Referral
dataElement.description: The reason for referral/transfer - e.g. diagnosis, treatment, transfer of care due to relocation, investigation, second opinion, management of the patient (e.g. palliative care), provide referrer with advice / guidance. This may include referral because of carers' concerns.

dataElement.name: Coded value
dataElement.description:
As above
(The reason for referral/transfer - e.g. diagnosis, treatment, transfer of care due to relocation, investigation, second opinion, management of the patient (e.g. palliative care), provide referrer with advice / guidance. This may include referral because of carers' concerns.)

extensions.extension: SNOMED CT: - ^1127581000000103 |Health issues simple reference set|

dataElement.name: Presenting complaints or issues
dataElement.description: The list and description of the health problems and issues experienced by the patient precipitating referral. This may include disease state, medical condition, response and reaction to therapies, e.g. blackout, dizziness, chest pain, follow-up from admission, falls, a specific procedure, investigation, family history or treatment.

dataElement.name: Coded value
dataElement.description:
As above
(The list and description of the health problems and issues experienced by the patient precipitating referral. This may include disease state, medical condition, response and reaction to therapies, e.g. blackout, dizziness, chest pain, follow-up from admission, falls, a specific procedure, investigation, family history or treatment.)

extensions.extension: This may be coded information from problem list on GP system. SNOMED CT coded & free text

dataElement.name: History of each presenting complaint or issue
dataElement.description: Information directly related to the development and characteristics of each presenting complaint (e.g. including travel history). Including if the information is given by the patient or their carer.

dataElement.name: Management to date
dataElement.description: Referrals, management, investigations and treatment that have already been undertaken, including patient managing their symptoms. Including: procedures conducted - procedures carried out (and the date) and procedure report.

dataElement.name: Date
dataElement.description: The date of referral

dataClass.name: Subject of care
dataClass.description: A care actor who is a person and seeks to receive, is receiving, or has received care.

dataClass.name: Person's name
dataClass.description: Details of the person's name

dataClass.name: Personal identification
dataClass.description: Unique identifier

dataElement.name: NHS Number
dataElement.description:
Format/Length:n10
National Codes:
Default Codes:

Notes:
NHS_NUMBER is the same as attribute NHS_NUMBER.

For the AIDC_for_Patient_Identification_Data_Set further guidance can be found on the NHS_Digital website at: DCB1077: AIDC for Patient Identification.

dataElement.name: National Insurance Number
dataElement.description: Additional unique identifier for people over the age of 16 in employment, receiving a pension, or in receipt of welfare benefits.

extensions.extension: Following combination of letters and numbers - two letters, six numbers, one letter. For example: QQ 123456 C

dataElement.name: Photograph
dataElement.description: A photograph of the person for identification and to show what the person looks like normally.

extensions.extension: Single image file. Max pixel dimensions?
File format: Jpg, Jpeg, Png, Gif

dataClass.name: Other person unique identifier
dataClass.description: e.g. An LA Client ID – a Person Unique Identifier - can be supplied to identify events for the same person, for whom the NHS number is missing (see LA Person Unique Identifier) Or a provider unique identifier

dataClass.name: Person's demographics
dataClass.description: Details of the person's demographics

dataElement.name: Date of birth
dataElement.description: The date of birth of the person.

extensions.extension: NHS data dictionary:- Person birth date

dataElement.name: Gender
dataElement.description: The person's stated gender.

extensions.extension: (1) Male, (2) Female, (9) Indeterminate (unable to be classified as either male or female), (x) Not Known (not recorded)
NHS data dictionary :- Person stated gender code

enumerations.enumeration: Indeterminate (unable to be classified as either male or female)

dataElement.name: Ethnicity
dataElement.description: The ethnicity of the person as specified by the person.

extensions.extension: The 16+1 ethnic data categories defined in the 2001 census is the national mandatory standard for the collection and analysis of ethnicity.

enumerations.enumeration: Asian or Asian British - Any other Asian background
Black or Black British - Any other Black background
Other Ethnic Groups - Any other ethnic group

dataElement.name: Religion
dataElement.description: The religious affiliation or other belief system as specified by the person.

extensions.extension: Aligned with descriptors for "Religious and Other Belief System Affiliation" in SNOMED
SNOMED_CT: ^999000531000000100 / NhS data dictionary : - Religion or other belief system

dataType.name: RELIGIOUS OR OTHER BELIEF SYSTEM AFFILIATION CODE TYPE

dataElement.name: Sex
dataElement.description: The person’s phenotypic sex - the sex when the person was born. Determines how the person will be treated clinically

extensions.extension: (1) Male, (2) Female, (9) Indeterminate (unable to be classified as either male or female), (x) Not Known (not recorded)
NHS data dictionary:- person phenotypic sex classification

enumerations.enumeration: Indeterminate (unable to be classified as either male or female)

dataElement.name: Marital status
dataElement.description: An indicator to identify the legal marital status of the person.

enumerations.enumeration: Divorced/Person whose Civil Partnership has been dissolved

dataClass.name: Person's address
dataClass.description:
Person’s usual place of residence, and where relevant temporary and correspondence addresses.
Guidance notes: address should be input via a national integration with services such as UPRN

dataElement.name: Address entry 1
dataElement.description: The first text string comprising one line of an ADDRESS.

dataElement.name: Address entry 2
dataElement.description: Building Name

dataElement.name: Address entry 3
dataElement.description: Street or Road Number

dataElement.name: Address entry 4
dataElement.description: Street or Road Name

dataElement.name: Address entry 5
dataElement.description: The fifth text string comprising one line of an ADDRESS.

dataElement.name: Postcode
dataElement.description: The person's postcode.

extensions.extension: Office for National Statistics (ONS) postcode data
NHS data dictionary :- Postcode of usual address

dataElement.name: Country
dataElement.description: The country of the person's pace of residence

dataElement.name: Currently resident
dataElement.description: Whether the person is currently residing at this address

dataElement.name: Address type
dataElement.description: A coded representation of an ADDRESS_ASSOCIATION.

extensions.extension: NHS data dictionary : - Address association type

dataClass.name: Person's contact details
dataClass.description: Telephone and email details

relationshipType.name: base
relationshipType.sourceToDestination: A Catalogue Element can be based on multiple Catalogue Elements of the same type. Value domains will first use rules of the base value domains and then their own when validating input values.
relationshipType.destinationToSource: A Catalogue Element can be base for multiple Catalogue Elements of the same type.

relationshipType.name: containment
relationshipType.sourceToDestination: A Data Class can contain multiple Data Elements. Contained Data Elements are finalized when the Class is finalized.
relationshipType.destinationToSource: A Data Element can be contained in multiple Data Classes. When a new draft of a Data Element is created, then drafts for all containing Data Classes are created as well.

relationshipType.name: declaration
relationshipType.sourceToDestination: Data Models can declare multiple Catalogue Elements. Based on this relationship you can narrow the Catalogue Elements shown in the Catalogue using the Data Model filter in the bottom left corner. When Data Model is finalized all defined Elements are finalized as well.
relationshipType.destinationToSource: A Catalogue Element can be declared within multiple Data Models. When new draft of the Catalogue Element is created then drafts for Data Models are created as well.

relationshipType.name: hierarchy
relationshipType.sourceToDestination: A Class can contain (be parent of) multiple Classes. Child Classes are finalized when parent Class is finalized.
relationshipType.destinationToSource: A Class can be contained (be child Class of) in multiple Classes. When a draft is created for child Class, drafts for parent Classes are created as well.

relationshipType.name: import
relationshipType.sourceToDestination: A Data Model can import other Data Models to reuse Catalogue Elements defined wtihin.
relationshipType.destinationToSource: A Data Model can be imported by other Data Models so they can reuse the Catalogue Elements defined within.

relationshipType.name: tag
relationshipType.sourceToDestination: A Tag may tag multiple Catalogue Elements
relationshipType.destinationToSource: Catalogue Elements can be tagged by multiple Tags
